The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet against the Philistines, before that Pharaoh smote Gaza.<RF>Gaza: Heb. Azzah<Rf>

Thus saith the LORD; Behold, waters rise up out of the north, and shall be an overflowing flood, and shall overflow the land, and all that is therein; the city, and them that dwell therein: then the men shall cry, and all the inhabitants of the land shall howl.<RF>all that…: Heb. the fulness thereof<Rf>

At the noise of the stamping of the hoofs of his strong <FI>horses<Fi>, at the rushing of his chariots, <FI>and at<Fi> the rumbling of his wheels, the fathers shall not look back to <FI>their<Fi> children for feebleness of hands;

Because of the day that cometh to spoil all the Philistines, <FI>and<Fi> to cut off from Tyrus and Zidon every helper that remaineth: for the LORD will spoil the Philistines, the remnant of the country of Caphtor.<RF>the country: Heb. the isle<Rf>
Baldness is come upon Gaza; Ashkelon is cut off <FI>with<Fi> the remnant of their valley: how long wilt thou cut thyself?
O thou sword of the LORD, how long <FI>will it be<Fi> ere thou be quiet? put up thyself into thy scabbard, rest, and be still.<RF>put…: Heb. gather thyself<Rf>
How can it be quiet, seeing the LORD hath given it a charge against Ashkelon, and against the sea shore? there hath he appointed it.<RF>How…: Heb. How canst thou<Rf><CM>
